description: Section 73 application for the variation of condition 19 (temporary sales unit) and condition 21 (A1/D1 use proportional split) and deletion of condition 20 (division of A1/D1 floorspace) of outline planning permission P110642 dated 02/09/2011 for the: 'layout', 'scale' and 'access' for the phased demolition and phased redevelopment of the Packington Estate allowing for the erection of part 1 to 8 storey buildings (some with basement level) to provide for 394 affordable dwellings comprising: 168x1; 111x2; 64x3; 34x3; 15x5 and 3x6 bedroom flats/maisonettes/houses (1315 habitable rooms), 301 market dwellings comprising: 170x1 and 125x2 bedroom flats/maisonettes and 6x studio apartments (722 habitable rooms), 702sqm of shop and non-residential institution floorspace (A1 and D1 use), 324sqm community centre (D1 use) and an outdoor recreation facility of no less than 446sqm, creation of open space (hard and soft landscaped and play areas) of no less than 6,783sqm, semi-private open space of no less than 265sqm and private gardens of no less than 10,956sqm, new roads and a cycle path, no more than 238 car parking spaces and no less than 590 bicycle spaces. The variation and deletion would secure the following changes: A] Requirement to divide the non-residential floorspace within Phase 2 into 3 units (67.6sqm, 93sqm and 131.5sqm) of class D1 use, and 1 unit (378sqm) of A1 use; and B] Associated amendments to some provisions and limits applicable to the A1 and D1 floorspace, and to the temporary sales unit on cessation of sales office use.
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposal and in particular the variation and deletion of conditions to enable the creation of a retail unit of 378 sqm would detract from and would adversely affect the character and identity of the local area and the borough which is defined in part by a good provision of small retail units. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies CS8 and CS14 of the Islington Core Strategy 2011, and emerging policy DM18 of the Development Management Policies (Submission version) 2012.
